Different and interesting physics becomes important in the complementary region Qr > Q (small Ay), a topic we address in Sec. We compare our resummed and finite-order predictions for the invariant mass (Q) dis- tribution of photon pairs, shown in Fig. A] as solid and dashed lines, respectively. The finite-order cross section is evaluated at O(a) accuracy in the qq@+qg channel and at O(a?) accuracy in the gg + gqs channel. These finite-order calculations are performed with the phase-spae sliing method desribed in Se. II B. When integrated over all QT , as in the dσ/dQ distribution at large Q, the resummed logarithmi terms from higher orders in αs also agree with the CDF data in this Q range within experimental unertainties. The shape of do/dQ at small Q is affected by the cuts in Eq. on the transverse momenta py of the two photons.
